definition: to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

sentences.english: Bush has done it so many times. he could do it with his eyes closed.
sentences.chinese: 这玩意布什做过多次了，他就是闭着眼睛也能做。

sentences.english: For this people's heart has become calloused; they hardly hear with their ears, and they have closed their eyes.
sentences.chinese: 因为这百姓油蒙了心，耳朵发沉，眼睛闭着。

sentences.english: Jim plays with her. His eyes close.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆这么念叨着她，闭着眼睛。

sentences.english: Kino could never remember seeing them closed when he awakened.
sentences.chinese: 奇诺一点也想不起，他在醒来时也曾看到它们闭着过。

sentences.english: Her eyes were lightly closed, as if in a day-dream or a light slumber.
sentences.chinese: 她二目轻轻地闭着，好象正做着美梦或微微入睡一般。

sentences.english: The manager sat quietly in his office, his eyes closed.
sentences.chinese: 经理静静地坐地办公室，眼睛闭着。

sentences.english: It lie there with its eyes closed, dead as a doornail.
sentences.chinese: 它躺在那里眼睛闭着，确实死了。

definition: to doze/to take a nap/nodding off to sleep
to open and close (the mouth etc)
to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct
to relax with one's eyes closed
